extendedMetadata.value: Chapter Quiz: Social Structure and Social Interaction

extendedMetadata.name: Objective
extendedMetadata.value: LO: 4.2: Explain the significance of social structure and its components: culture, social class, social status, roles, groups, and social institutions; compare the functionalist and conflict perspectives on social structure; and explain what holds society together.

config.question: Which of the following statements about groups is correct?

choices.content: Being a member of a group means a person must yield to others the right to make decisions and judgments about his or her behavior.
Groups are more likely to cohere when everyone shares the same amount of prestige.
The roles someone plays do not affect his or her status within a group.
Status inconsistency is inevitable within any group.

answer_3.response: sider this: Different members play different roles in each group. These different roles carry varying levels of status. LO 4.2 Explain the significance of social structure and its components: culture, social class, social status, roles, groups, and social institutions; compare the functionalist and conflict perspectives on social structure; and explain what holds society together.
